Name: Tandem Strike
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: You and your eidolon each attack, seamlessly targeting the same foe without interfering with each other's movements.

Name: Tempest-Sun Redirection
Prerequisites: Magaambyan Attendant Dedication; Tempest-Sun Mages affiliation
Benefits: If the next action you use is to Cast a Spell from your spell slots that damages other creatures, you can bend some of that spell’s offensive energy, protecting allies in the area and boosting your own defenses against certain foes.

Name: Thorough Research
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: When you succeed at a Recall Knowledge check, you learn an additional fact about the subject.

Name: Tiger Slash
Benefits: You make a fierce swipe with both hands.

Name: Triple Shot
Benefits: You can quickly fire multiple shots with greater control.

Name: Twist the Knife
Benefits: After stabbing your opponent in a weak spot, you tear the wound open.

Name: Unnerving Prowess
Benefits: Make a free Demoralize check when you critically succeed with your dueling sword.

Name: Urgent Upwelling
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: Defeat lets you to tap into your wellspring.

Name: Uzunjati Storytelling
Prerequisites: Magaambyan Attendant Dedication; Uzunjati affiliation; master in a Recall Knowledge skill
Benefits: You tell a quick story or begin telling a longer tale.

Name: Vacate Vision
Benefits: You cause your eyes to liquefy and run out of your eye sockets, leaving them empty.

Name: Vexing Tumble
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You tumble around your foes, expertly avoiding their reactions.

Name: Viking Weapon Specialist
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You are even more skilled in the weapons of your people.

Name: Warding Rune
Benefits: Your runes provide a warding effect that protects you against a specific school of magic.

Name: Watch Your Back
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You menace the target, stoking their fears and drawing their attention.

Name: Water Step
Benefits: You can Stride across liquid and surfaces that don’t support your weight.

Name: Westyr's Wayfinder Repository
Prerequisites: Pathfinder Agent Dedication; Wayfinder Resonance Tinkerer
Benefits: You can use your wayfinder to store a little extra magic for when you need it most.

Name: Whirling Throw
Benefits: You propel your grabbed or restrained foe a great distance.

Name: Witch's Charge
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You forge a magical link with another creature, granting you awareness of that creature's condition and creating a conduit for spellcasting.

Name: Wolf Drag
Benefits: You rip your enemy off their feet.

Name: Advanced First Aid
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Use First Aid to reduce frightened and sickened condition values.

Name: Aerobatics Mastery
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Improve your ability to Maneuver in Flight.

Name: Battle Cry
Benefits: Demoralizes foes when you roll for initiative.

Name: Battle Prayer
Prerequisites: you follow a deity; master in Religion
Benefits: Calling out to your deity, you recite scripture to harm a foe

Name: Biographical Eye
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Intuit details about someone’s profession and residence.

Name: Bizarre Magic
Benefits: Your magic becomes more difficult to identify.

Name: Bless Tonic
Prerequisites: deity who grants heal divine font; master in Crafting
Benefits: You channel positive energy into restoratives that ward against harm

Name: Bless Toxin
Prerequisites: deity who grants harm divine font; master in Crafting
Benefits: You pour negative energy into toxins you create to further debilitate your targets

Name: Consult the Spirits
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Learn about your environment from resident spirits.

Name: Disturbing Knowledge
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Frighten foes with occult secrets.

Name: Doublespeak
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Pass a secret message to allies in your conversation.

Name: Entourage
Benefits: You have a small group of admirers who tend to follow you around while you’re in civilized settlements.

Name: Environmental Grace
Prerequisites: deity who grants the cold, fire, nature, or travel domain; master in Survival
Benefits: You rapidly adapt to environments through a combination of skill, meditation, and divine grace

Name: Evangelize
Prerequisites: you follow a deity or philosophy; master in Diplomacy
Benefits: You point out a detail that incontrovertibly supports your faith, causing a listener’s mind to whirl

Name: Expeditious Search
Benefits: Search areas in half the time.

Name: Expert Disassembler
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You can apply the same techniques you use to reverse engineer objects to disable them.

Name: Fabricated Connections
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You can lie about having taken an action so convincingly that you acquire all the tangible benefits of having successfully completed it.

Name: Foil Senses
Benefits: Take precautions against special senses.

Name: Graceful Leaper
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Mass and muscle are meaningless when you leap; only grace and balance matter.

Name: Impeccable Crafter
Benefits: Craft items more efficiently.

Name: Influence Nature
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Influence the behavior of certain animals in the area.

Name: Inventor
Benefits: Use Crafting to create item formulas.

Name: Kip Up
Benefits: Stand up for free without triggering reactions.

Name: Numb to Death
Prerequisites: Diehard; you have died at least once
Benefits: Your past has left you numb to death’s call

Name: Paragon Battle Medicine
Benefits: Kassi Aziril taught you her techniques that originated the modern use of Battle Medicine.

Name: Party Crasher
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You attend all the fashionable society parties, no matter how exclusive they might be.

Name: Planar Survival
Benefits: Use Survival to Subsist on different planes.

Name: Prescient Consumable
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Procure consumable items with Prescient Planner.

Name: Quick Change
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You can shift between your identities with ease.

Name: Quick Climber
Benefits: Climb swiftly.

Name: Quick Recognition
Prerequisites: Recognize Spell; master in Arcana, Nature, Occultism, or Religion
Benefits: Master in Arcana, Nature, Occultism, Identify spells as a free action.

Name: Quick Swim
Benefits: Swim quickly.

Name: Quick Unlock
Benefits: Pick a Lock with 1 action.

Name: Rapid Affixture
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Afﬁx a Talisman in less time.

Name: Read Shibboleths
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: All communication is filled with slight tells and signals.

Name: Sacred Defense
Prerequisites: you follow a deity; master in Religion
Benefits: You call upon your deity to grant you their protective blessing

Name: Sanctify Water
Prerequisites: good or evil deity; master in Religion
Benefits: You imbue water with your deity’s blessing

Name: Scholastic Identification
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You have the knowledge needed to understand ancient texts and cultural artifacts.

Name: Shameless Request
Benefits: Make Requests of others with lesser consequences.

Name: Slippery Secrets
Benefits: Evade attempts to uncover your true nature.

Name: Subjective Truth
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your disparate identities allow you to defeat magic that detects lies.

Name: Supertaster
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Gain secret checks to detect poison by taste.

Name: Swift Sneak
Benefits: Move your full Speed while you Sneak.

Name: Terrified Retreat
Benefits: Cause foes you Demoralize to flee.

Name: Wall Jump
Benefits: Jump off walls.

Name: Water Sprint
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Stride across the surface of a body of water.

Name: Able Ritualist
Source: Pathfinder #164
Benefits: Your readings on rituals make you a skilled participant.

Name: Accompany
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You use your performances to supplement an ally's spellcasting, providing magical energy for their spells.

Name: Achaekek's Grip
Benefits: You sense if a creature you have slain in the last year has been restored to life, as long as you and that creature are on the same plane.

Name: Acquired Tolerance
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: A small amount of poison, taken at nonlethal doses, can help the body build up a resistance against a more deadly dosage.

Name: Advanced Deity's Domain
Benefits: Through your conviction, you have glimpsed the deeper secrets of your deity’s domain.

Name: Advanced Domain
Benefits: Your studies or prayers have unlocked deeper secrets of your deity’s domain.

Name: Advanced School Spell
Benefits: You gain access to a powerful new school spell depending on your arcane school.

Name: Align Armament
Prerequisites: chaotic, evil, good, or lawful deity
Benefits: You bring a weapon into metaphysical concordance with your deity’s beliefs.

Name: Ambushing Knockdown
Benefits: You emerge from hiding and deliver a blow that can knock an enemy sprawling to the ground.

Name: Animal Rage
Benefits: You transform into your animal.

Name: Arcane Breadth
Benefits: You can cast more arcane spells each day.

Name: Archaeologist's Luck
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You are more than just skillful; your drive to find the secrets of the past manifests as a strange kind of luck.

Name: Archer's Aim
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You slow down, focus, and take a careful shot.

Name: Armiger's Mobility
Prerequisites: expert in heavy armor; Hellknight Armiger Dedication
Benefits: You’ve learned how best to move in heavy armor.

Name: Armored Rebuff
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You rebuff puny attacks with your armor, knocking back your foe.

Name: Arrow Snatching
Benefits: You pluck missiles from the air and hurl them back at their source.

Name: Attuned Stride
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: You can move freely through terrain you're attuned to.

Name: Back to Back
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You excel at watching your allies' backs and helping them watch yours.

Name: Basic Eldritch Archer Spellcasting
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You gain the basic spellcasting benefits.

Name: Bleeding Finisher
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your blow inflicts profuse bleeding.

Name: Blessed Spell
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Prerequisites: Blessed One Dedication; ability to cast spells from spell slots; Mercy
Benefits: When you focus your magic on an ally, you can remove harmful conditions.

Name: Blind-Fight
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your battle instincts make you more aware of concealed and invisible opponents.

Name: Bloodline Breadth
Benefits: Your repertoire expands, and you can cast more spells of your bloodline’s tradition each day.

Name: Bloodline Resistance
Benefits: Your magical blood makes you more resistant to magic.

Name: Bond Conservation
Benefits: By carefully manipulating the arcane energies stored in your bonded item as you drain it, you can conserve just enough power to cast another, slightly weaker spell.

Name: Boost Summons
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: Augmenting your eidolon extends to creatures you summon.

Name: Bravo's Determination
Prerequisites: Firebrand Braggart Dedication; expert in Deception
Benefits: Your confidence borders on self-delusion, but it keeps you going against overwhelming odds.

Name: Breath of the Dragon
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You can use a powerful breath weapon, much like the dragon you emulate.

Name: Bullseye
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You carefully take aim before making your attack in order to avoid your foe's concealment and cover.

Name: Call and Response
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your composition takes the form of a call-and-response chant, which lets your allies continue the effect without you.

Name: Call Your Shot
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: When you successfully Play to the Crowd, add additional benefits to the list you can choose from.

Name: Capture Magic
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: When you resist a spell, you capture some of its magic for your own use.

Name: Channeled Succor
Benefits: You can remove conditions with divine grace.

Name: Clinging Shadows Initiate
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You learn a mystical stance that transforms your ki into sticky smoke that shrouds your limbs, clinging to everything you touch.

Name: Clue Them All In
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You can clue in all your allies at once.

Name: Constricting Hold
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: Your eidolon constricts the creature, dealing bludgeoning damage equal to your eidolon's level plus its Strength modifier, with a basic Fortitude save against your spell DC.

Name: Courageous Opportunity
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You bellow a ferocious call to arms, inspiring yourself to lash out at a foe.

Name: Cremate Undead
Benefits: Your positive energy sets undead alight.

Name: Crossblooded Evolution
Benefits: Odd interactions in your bloodline provide you with unexpected spells.

Name: Crude Communication
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Even if you don't speak a creature's language, you can rely on inflection, root words, and body language to infer rudimentary meaning.

Name: Deadly Aim
Benefits: You aim for your prey’s weak spots, making your shot more challenging but dealing more damage if you hit.

Name: Deadly Butterfly
Source: Pathfinder #166
Benefits: You gain access to the butterfly sword's critical specialization effect.

Name: Debilitating Dichotomy
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You can give others a glimpse of the impossible conflicts and unchecked power that courses through your body.

Name: Deeper Dabbler
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: With some streamlining to your process and a deeper collection of talisman materials, you make a greater number of talismans every day.

Name: Deimatic Display
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Imitating animal threat displays, you make yourself appear larger and more imposing.

Name: Delay Trap
Benefits: You can jam the workings of a trap to delay its effects.

Name: Disarming Assault
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You attack with enough force to knock the weapon out of your foe's hands.

Name: Disorienting Opening
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You use your foes' openings to expose even greater weaknesses.

Name: Diverse Recognition
Prerequisites: Pathfinder Agent Dedication; master in a skill used to Recall Knowledge
Benefits: Your Pathfinder training allows you to quickly size up numerous threats.

Name: Divine Breadth
Benefits: You can cast more divine spells each day.

Name: Dual Finisher
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You split your attacks.

Name: Dualistic Synergy
Benefits: If your next action is to Cast a Spell from your spell slots, you gain a benefit.

Name: Dueling Riposte
Benefits: You riposte against your flailing enemy.

Name: Eclectic Skill
Benefits: Your broad experiences translate to a range of skills.

Name: Efficient Rituals
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You can perform some rituals in less time.

Name: Elude the Divine
Benefits: You are able to escape inquisitions involving divine magic, allowing you to blend in well in Mzali but also to avoid unwanted attention in other oppressive theocracies.

Name: Emblazon Energy
Benefits: With elemental forces, you make your emblazoned symbols more potent.

Name: Enchanting Arrow
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: With a single whisper carried on the wind, you enchant your ammunition to make a foe more vulnerable to your attacks.

Name: Energy Resistance
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: Your eidolon has stronger resistance.

Name: Enlarge Companion
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You make your companion enormous.

Name: Familiar Form
Benefits: You can use your magic to transform into a small creature of a type that commonly serves as a spellcaster's familiar, potentially allowing you to safely scout for your party while retaining a degree of spellcasting ability.

Name: Felling Strike
Benefits: Your attack can ground an airborne foe.

Name: Feral Mutagen
Benefits: Your bestial mutagen brings out the beast lurking within you.

Name: Ferocious Shape
Benefits: You have mastered the shape of ferocious dinosaurs.

Name: Fey Caller
Benefits: You have learned some of the tricks the fey use to bend primal magic toward illusions and trickery.

Name: Fiery Retort
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: Ignoring your pain, you sear your attacker with a wave of flame.

Name: Flamboyant Cruelty
Benefits: You love to kick your enemies when they're down, and you look fabulous when you do.

Name: Flensing Slice
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: When you hit with both attacks with Double Slice, you flense the target, making it bleed and creating a weak spot.

Name: Follow-Up Assault
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Even in the face of failure you press the attack, determined to succeed.

Name: Foolproof Instructions
Benefits: You feel confident that you can explain your scrolls so well that even your allies can use them.

Name: Form Retention
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You have trained your mind and body to tolerate polymorph magic for longer periods of time, so long as you prepare for the change appropriately.

Name: Fortified Flesh
Benefits: Your flesh is resistent to physical damage.

Name: Friendly Toss
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You toss your friends around the battlefield.

Name: Furious Bully
Benefits: You bully foes across the battlefield.

Name: Fused Staff
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: When you prepare a staff, you can hold it up to a weapon to merge the two items.

Name: Garden Path
Benefits: You can guide your crop to move without notice.

Name: Glyph Expert
Benefits: You've learned to recognize the telltale writings and other signs that indicate the presence of magical traps.

Name: Golden League Xun Dedication
Benefits: You are a xun for the Golden League, aiding the organization.

Name: Golem Grafter Dedication
Prerequisites: expert in Arcana and Crafting, or an ally with expert proficiency in those skills willing to augment you
Benefits: Your flesh has been specially treated with the same arcane and alchemical processes used to toughen the skin of flesh golems.

Name: Great Boaster
Benefits: Your bragging is particularly effective.

Name: Greater Cruelty
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: The extent of the corruption within you does more than simply sap your foes' strength, it devastates their minds and reflexes.

Name: Greater Mercy
Benefits: Your faith enhances your ability to remove conditions.

Name: Grievous Blow
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You know how to deliver focused, powerful blows that bypass your enemies' resistances.

Name: Hazard Finder
Benefits: You have an intuitive ability to sense hazards.

Name: Heal Mount
Prerequisites: divine ally (steed); devotion spell (lay on hands)
Benefits: Your devotion to your mount manifests as a surge of positive energy.

Name: Hulking Size
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: Your eidolon grows substantially.

Name: Impassable Wall Stance
Benefits: You refuse to let foes past your guard.

Name: Improved Poison Weapon
Benefits: You deliver poisons in ways that maximize their harmful effects.

Name: Improvised Crafting
Benefits: You've learned to repair your equipment even in challenging circumstances, making use of what you have available.

Name: Improvised Critical
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You can apply critical specialization effects to improvised weapons you wield.

Name: Incredible Aim
Benefits: By spending a moment to focus, you can ensure your attack strikes true.

Name: Incredible Beastmaster's Companion
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your mature animal companions continue to grow and develop.

Name: Incredible Companion (Druid)
Benefits: Your animal companion continues to grow and develop.

Name: Incredible Familiar (Witch)
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your familiar is imbued with even more magic than other familiars.

Name: Incredible Mount
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Under your care and training, your mount has realized its innate potential.

Name: Innate Magic Intuition
Benefits: You've spent countless hours learning to recognize and predict a creature's innate magical abilities.

Name: Insistent Command
Source: Pathfinder #152
Prerequisites: Animal Trainer Dedication; master in Nature
Benefits: When you roll a success to Command an Animal, you get a critical success.

Name: Inspirational Performance
Benefits: You gain the inspire courage composition cantrip.

Name: Inspire Heroics
Benefits: Your performances inspire even greater deeds in your allies.

Name: Inspired Stratagem
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You quickly advise your ally, using your earlier planning to make sure luck can't throw a wrench in the cogs of your schemes.

Name: Instinctive Strike
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Prerequisites: Acute Scent or precise or imprecise scent
Benefits: You trust your instincts and your sense of smell, using all of your senses to pinpoint your opponent's location.

Name: Invoke the Crimson Oath
Benefits: You can invoke the Crimson Oath to unleash blasts of ruby energy from your weapon.

Name: Ironblood Stance
Benefits: You enter the stance of impenetrable iron, refusing to yield to any blow.

Name: Know-It-All
Benefits: Your knowledge of the world expands beyond what you have read.

Name: Lethargy Poisoner
Source: Pathfinder #165
Prerequisites: Drow Shootist Dedication; trained in Crafting
Benefits: You've learned more than the use of hand crossbows from drow lore.

Name: Levering Strike
Source: Pathfinder #151
Benefits: Strike your foe and make them unbalanced

Name: Loaner Spell
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Prerequisites: trained in Arcana, Nature, Occultism, or Religion
Benefits: During your daily preparations, you can gain the assistance of an allied prepared spellcaster to prepare one spell for the day.

Name: Lobbed Attack
Source: Pathfinder #151
Benefits: Make an unexpected ranged attack with a Juggled item.

Name: Lore Seeker
Benefits: You see what others don’t, and you’ve developed magical tricks to find hidden truth.

Name: Lorefinder
Source: Pathfinder #164
Benefits: You know that fate sometimes conspires to keep dangerous knowledge or items from the eyes of those most able to understand them.

Name: Magic Arrow
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You imbue your ammunition with eldritch power.

Name: Magic Finder
Benefits: You've learned a few tricks to ensure you find every last magic item and interesting magical effect during your missions.

Name: Magical Adept
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: Your eidolon gains more magic.

Name: Makeshift Strike
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You quickly snatch up whatever's nearby and then attack with it as an improvised weapon.

Name: Mantis Form
Benefits: You can transform yourself into a mantis battle form.

Name: Many Guises
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You can take on any number of mundane guises.

Name: Martyr
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You go to extreme lengths to support your allies, even when it means bringing harm to yourself.

Name: Masked Casting
Benefits: You harness the magical energy flowing through your eyeless mask to effortlessly protect you from visual effects.

Name: Metabolize Element
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: Your rapidly metabolize the elemental particles in your opponent's spell to gain a boost of energy.

Name: Miniaturize
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: Your eidolon can shrink even further.

Name: Mixed Maneuver
Benefits: You combine two different maneuvers together into a single flowing whole.

Name: Mobile Shot Stance
Benefits: Your shots become nimble and deadly.

Name: Monk Moves
Benefits: You gain a +10-foot status bonus to your Speed when you’re not wearing armor.

Name: Murksight
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your vision pierces through non-magical fog, mist, rain, and snow.

Name: Mutable Familiar
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your familiar's supernatural spirit has outgrown its corporeal body.

Name: Mysterious Breadth
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Increase the spell slots you gain from oracle archetype feats by 1 for each spell level other than your two highest spell levels.

Name: Necromantic Tenacity
Benefits: Reduce the power that necromantic effects hold over you.

Name: Nimble Roll
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You throw yourself into a roll to escape imminent danger.

Name: Occult Breadth
Benefits: Your repertoire expands, and you can cast more occult spells each day.

Name: Ooze Empathy
Prerequisites: Oozemorph Dedication; at least two other class feats from the oozemorph archetype
Benefits: You can connect with oozes (and other amorphous aberrations, at the GM's discretion) on a rudimentary level.

Name: Opportune Backstab
Benefits: When your enemy is hit by your ally, you capitalize upon the distraction.

Name: Opportunistic Grapple
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You attempt an Athletics check to Grapple your prey.

Name: Order Training
Benefits: You gain the lesser order benefit for the Hellknight order to which you belong.

Name: Patron's Breadth
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You can cast more spells each day.

Name: Peer Beyond
Benefits: You have uncanny insight into the way ghosts and haunts manifest, manipulate the mind, and rejuvenate.

Name: Perpetual Breadth
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You have expanded your supply of near-infinite items.

Name: Persistent Creation
Benefits: You can cast creation as an innate spell at will, choosing whether it is arcane or primal each time.

Name: Physical Training
Prerequisites: Swordmaster Dedication; expert in Acrobatics and Athletics
Benefits: You spend a lot of time focusing on your physical fitness.

Name: Pinning Fire
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You target your opponent's clothing, equipment, or loose flesh with piercing projectiles to pin them to the ground or a nearby surface.

Name: Pinpoint Poisoner
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Unsuspecting targets are especially vulnerable to your poisons.

Name: Positioning Assault
Benefits: With punishing blows, you force your opponent into position.

Name: Powerful Snares
Benefits: Your snares are particularly dif cult for enemies to avoid.

Name: Practiced Guidance
Benefits: You can better Aid your crop.

Name: Precious Arrow
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You enchant a piece of ammunition with the magical essence of a precious material, allowing you to leverage certain creatures' weaknesses.

Name: Predictive Purchase (Rogue)
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You somehow manage to have just the thing for the situation.

Name: Primal Breadth
Benefits: You can cast more primal spells per day.

Name: Protect Ally
Benefits: You place your body between your friends and your enemies, protecting your allies against oncoming attacks.

Name: Quick Block
Benefits: You can block with your shield instinctively.

Name: Quick Shield Block
Benefits: You can bring your shield into place with hardly a thought.

Name: Quick Stow (Swordmaster)
Benefits: You know that situations can change rapidly and might leave you needing to change equipment in the middle of combat.

Name: Read Disaster
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You spend 10 minutes and open yourself to the divine mysteries of the world, peering into the most sinister portents of the future.

Name: Recognize Threat
Prerequisites: master in a Recall Knowledge skill; Pathfinder Agent Dedication
Benefits: You quickly assess the threat so you can relay the information to your team.

Name: Reflexive Grip
Benefits: You keep hold of your weapons even when knocked out.

Name: Renewed Vigor
Benefits: You pause to recover your raging vigor.

Name: Resounding Bravery
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Even your fears serve as fuel for your fighting spirit.

Name: Ricochet Stance (Rogue)
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You adopt a stance to rebound your thrown weapons toward you.

Name: Rippling Spin
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: After the triggering attack is done, Step.

Name: Rule of Three
Source: Pathfinder #170
Benefits: Heroes learn from their previous failures, often succeeding on the third attempt.

Name: Runic Impression
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: You can temporarily replicate the effects of a property rune for your weapon or unarmed attacks.

Name: Sacrifice Armor
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: With divine awareness, you twist your body to lessen the impact of an attack.

Name: Safeguarded Spell
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You bring the magical wavelengths of your spell into sync with the ones produced by your own body.

Name: Scarecrow
Benefits: You fight fiercely to protect your crop.

Name: Second Ally
Benefits: Your inner grace attracts the attention of a second protective spirit.

Name: Selfless Parry
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You protect those near you with a flash of steel.

Name: Sense Chaos
Benefits: You sense chaos as an unsettling feeling of nervous energy.

Name: Sense Evil
Benefits: You sense evil as a queasy or foreboding feeling.

Name: Sense Good
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: The presence of goodness sickens you with its saccharine self-righteousness.

Name: Shadow Spell
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: You attach a piece of your shadow to a spell to cloud the senses and cause mischief.

Name: Shadowdancer Dedication
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Prerequisites: expert in Performance and master in Stealth
Benefits: You dedicate yourself to the shadows.

Name: Share Rage
Benefits: You stoke an ally’s fury.

Name: Shoving Sweep
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You swing your weapon at your foe, rebuffing them back.

Name: Sidestep
Benefits: You deftly step out of the way of an attack, letting the blow continue to the creature next to you.

Name: Sin Reservoir
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: During daily preparations, you can indulge in your associated sin.

Name: Sixth Pillar Dedication
Prerequisites: ability to cast spells; Dexterity 14; expert in Acrobatics
Benefits: You use your physical discipline to channel your magic.

Name: Skill Mastery (Investigator)
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Prerequisites: Investigator Dedication; trained in at least one skill and expert in at least one skill
Benefits: Increase your proficiency rank in one of your skills from expert to master and in another of your skills from trained to expert.

Name: Skill Mastery (Rogue)
Prerequisites: Rogue Dedication; trained in at least one skill and expert in at least one skill
Benefits: Increase your proficiency rank in one of your skills from expert to master.

Name: Skim Scroll
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You can activate the magic of a scroll with a cursory read as you draw it from your belt.

Name: Skyseeker
Benefits: You Leap toward an opponent.

Name: Sly Striker
Benefits: Your attacks deal more damage, even against creatures that aren’t flat-footed.

Name: Snap Out of It! (Pathfinder Agent)
Prerequisites: Pathfinder Agent Dedication; master in Medicine
Benefits: Pathfinders are trained to help each other be safe and successful, and you know how to jolt your allies back to their senses.

Name: Soaring Shape
Benefits: Wings free you from the shackles of the ground below.

Name: Soulsight
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Prerequisites: [Sorcerer] bloodline that grants divine or occult spells
Benefits: Your muse has opened your senses to the world beyond.

Name: Spell Swipe
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: You attack in an arc and enact your spell against everyone you hit.

Name: Standby Spell
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: You've honed one spell as your favored combat technique, and you've practiced it enough that you no longer need to prepare it to cast it.

Name: Sticky Bomb
Benefits: You mix in an additive to make your bomb’s contents adhere to the target and continue to deal damage.

Name: Stunning Finisher
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You attempt a dizzying blow.

Name: Subtle Shank
Benefits: You draw a concealed weapon, attack with it, and then hide it away again in one smooth motion.

Name: Sudden Leap
Benefits: You swing at a foe while mid-leap.

Name: Surging Focus
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: When an ally you can see falls in battle, your fight or flight response triggers a surge in your deity's might within you.

Name: Surreptitious Spellcaster
Benefits: You’ve learned that it pays for a Pathfinder to be able to cast spells without being noticed.

Name: Survivor of Desolation
Benefits: You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to saving throws against unnatural weather events or environmental hazards occurring in blighted or otherwise unnaturally marred regions.

Name: Swashbuckler's Speed
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You move faster, with or without panache.

Name: Syu Tak-Nwa's Hexed Locks
Source: Pathfinder #166
Benefits: Your hair attacks gain the reach trait and you can deliver hexes through it.

Name: Tactical Entry
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Stride without triggering reactions

Name: Tangled Forest Stance
Benefits: You extend your arms like gnarled branches to interfere with your foes’ movements.

Name: Terrain Master
Benefits: You adapt to your surroundings in any natural terrain.

Name: Thrash
Benefits: You thrash the grabbed foe around.

Name: To Battle!
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: With a resounding cry, you rally your ally to the offensive.

Name: Transcribe Moment
Benefits: You gain the transcribe moment focus spell.

Name: Tumbling Strike
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Attempt an Acrobatics check against the Reflex DC of an enemy adjacent to you.

Name: Unfazed Assessment
Source: Pathfinder #149
Prerequisites: Zephyr Guard Dedication; expert in Perception
Benefits: You have witnessed hundreds of fighting styles and quickly adapt to defend against complicated maneuvers.

Name: Universal Versatility
Prerequisites: universalist wizard; Hand of the Apprentice
Benefits: You can access the fundamental abilities of any school of magic.

Name: Unravel Mysteries
Prerequisites: master in a Decipher Writing skill; Scrollmaster Dedication
Benefits: You can understand the true meaning of texts quickly, and even when you get lost or hit a dead end, you aren’t discouraged from making further attempts to get to the bottom of things.

Name: Unshakable Idealism
Prerequisites: Knight Vigilant; expert in Will saves
Benefits: Your faith and hope can’t be shaken, and you won’t flee when lives are at stake.

Name: Vivacious Bravado
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your ego swells, granting you a temporary reprieve from your pain.

Name: Walk the Plank
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You frighten a foe into moving where you want them, traditionally demanding they walk the plank.

Name: Wall Run
Benefits: You defy gravity, traversing vertical planes as easily as the ground.

Name: Warden's Boon
Benefits: By pointing out vulnerabilities, you grant an ally benefits from your hunting abilities.

Name: Wayfinder Resonance Infiltrator
Prerequisites: Pathfinder Agent Dedication; Wayfinder Resonance Tinkerer
Benefits: You are adept at using the unusual resonance of your wayfinder to aid in any deceptions you might employ.

Name: Whodunnit?
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You carefully consider your case and narrow down some of the details.

Name: Wild Winds Initiate
Benefits: You learn a mystical stance that lets you attack from a distance.

Name: Wind Caller
Benefits: You bid the winds to lift and carry you through the air.

Name: Witch's Bottle
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You spend 10 minutes and 1 Focus Point brewing a special potion containing the power of one of your hexes that targets a creature.

Name: Work Yourself Up
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: You concentrate on your mental state, tapping into that raw emotional energy.

Name: Aboleth Transmutation
Source: Azarketi Ancestry Web Supplement
Benefits: You have tapped into the ancient magic used by alghollthu masters to mold the flesh of your ancestors.

Name: Absorb Toxin
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Prerequisites: You are not immune to diseases or poisons
Benefits: Your skin readily absorbs poison and can consciously draw toxins into your body to spare others.

Name: Accursed Claws
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your claws carry your mother's hag magic.

Name: Agathion Magic
Benefits: The harmonious magic of Nirvana flows through you.

Name: Aggravating Scratch
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your claws carry an irritant that is harmless to you but can be damaging to others.

Name: Analyze Information
Benefits: You can stoke your mind into a burst of analytical prowess.

Name: Anarchic Arcana
Benefits: The magic in your blood is unpredictable.

Name: Ancillary Motes
Benefits: You can use Crystalline Dust one more time per day.

Name: Angelic Magic
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You can tap into the magic of angels that runs through your blood.

Name: Animal Magic
Benefits: Your shapeshifting grants you a magical connection to the animal world.

Name: Archon Magic
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You can tap into the heavenly magic that is your birthright.

Name: Azarketi Purification
Benefits: You can cast purify food and drink as a primal innate spell, but only on liquids.

Name: Azata Magic
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your lineage traces back to the realm of Elysium, and you can harness its magic using this connection.

Name: Bark and Tendril
Benefits: You wield primal magic.

Name: Battleforger
Benefits: You can sharpen weapons, polish armor, and apply special techniques to temporarily gain better effects from your armaments.

Name: Between the Scales
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Underestimating you is a grave mistake, but it's one others keep making.

Name: Big Mouth
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your cheek pouches are especially stretchy.

Name: Bloodletting Fangs
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You emulate your vampiric parent's techniques for drawing blood from a victim.

Name: Bone Caller
Benefits: Using a mixture of dinosaur bones and the bones of your ancestors to focus your magic, you animate lizards and dinosaurs to carry messages or serve as mounts.

Name: Breath Like Honey
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: You smell of honey and savory things.

Name: Briar Battler
Benefits: You've learned to use roots, crevices, uneven ground, and dense underbrush to your advantage.

Name: Brightness Seeker
Benefits: Once per day, you can spend 10 minutes studying your surroundings in search of omens related to a particular course of action to cast augury as an innate divine spell.

Name: Call of Elysium
Benefits: The wild wonder of Elysium harmonizes within you, and in dire straits, you can share its benefits with your allies.

Name: Cantorian Rejuvenation
Benefits: The life-giving energy that flows in your blood revitalizes you.

Name: Captivating Curiosity
Benefits: You can snare the attentions of onlookers with your unique appearance.

Name: Catrina's Presence
Benefits: You've adopted the calming presence of catrinas, the festive dead..

Name: Cautious Curiosity
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Prerequisites: at least one arcane or occult innate spell gained from a gnome heritage or gnome ancestry feat
Benefits: You've learned a few magical techniques for getting yourself both into and out of trouble unnoticed.

Name: Cave Climber
Benefits: After years of crawling and climbing through caverns, you can climb easily anywhere you go.

Name: Celestial Wings
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: With effort, you can call forth magical wings from your back, similar in appearance to those of your celestial forebears.

Name: Ceremony of Aeon's Guidance
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: Your patron aeon has allowed you to call upon their gifts to serve their ends.

Name: Ceremony of Aeon's Shield
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: Your patron aeon graced you with powers of protection.

Name: Ceremony of Fortification
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: Your exoskeleton arranges itself into an optimal defensive shape.

Name: Ceremony of the Strengthened Hand
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: Your exoskeleton's weapons are even more potent.

Name: Charred Remains
Benefits: Your next fire spell leaves embers in its wake.

Name: Cling
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You hang onto a foe to harry them into submission.

Name: Close Quarters
Benefits: You've trained to fight with allies in tunnel warrens, dense undergrowth, or similarly cramped terrain.

Name: Coating of Slime
Benefits: An acidic ooze coats your limbs.

Name: Constant Gaze
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: Your eyes keep a continual watch for dangers from all sides.

Name: Cooperative Soul
Benefits: You have developed a soul-deep bond with your comrades and maintain an even greater degree of cooperation with them.

Name: Crystalline Cloud
Benefits: When you use Crystalline Dust, you can spend one additional action to disperse the motes as a 10-foot-radius cloud centered on you instead of as haze; the activity gains the concentrate trait.

Name: Cunning Climber
Benefits: Whether you are climbing a ship’s rigging, a jungle tree, or a clock tower, you have an uncanny knack for finding footholds and handholds where larger creatures can’t.

Name: Daemon Magic
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: The magic of Abaddon runs through your blood, and you can wield that power.

Name: Dance Underfoot
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You dart under the legs of your enemies in combat.

Name: Dangle
Benefits: You can hang by your tail from any suitable anchor point, such as a tree branch, balcony, or rocky outcropping (subject to the GM's discretion), typically while climbing.

Name: Death's Drums
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your life has been spent challenging death itself, and proximity to that implacable foe only makes your heart beat harder.

Name: Defensive Instincts
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: Your body tenses up when surrounded, putting you on edge just enough to anticipate an attack.

Name: Demon Magic
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You can channel the power of the Abyss through your heritage, producing terrible tangible effects.

Name: Devil Magic
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Drawing on the infernal power of your sinister forbears, you mislead your foes with magical deception.

Name: Dig Up Secrets
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: You are an endless well of knowledge and can remember several vital pieces of information at once.

Name: Disorienting Venom
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: The venom injected by your fangs disorients your foes.

Name: Divine Countermeasures
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You've studied your celestial heritage with the intent of better defending yourself, and you've found that your techniques are equally powerful against celestials, fiends, and other divine entities.

Name: Djinni Magic
Benefits: The magic of djinn runs through your blood.

Name: Dracomancer
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your inborn arcane power manifests as your exemplar's most time-honored spells.

Name: Dragon Grip
Benefits: Your hold has a unique draconic connection.

Name: Dragon Prince
Benefits: The blood of the Dragon Kings runs strong in your veins.

Name: Dragonblood Paragon
Prerequisites: Strongjaw Kobold heritage, Dracomancer, Kobold Breath, or Venomtail Kobold heritage
Benefits: Your draconic anatomy becomes especially pronounced.

Name: Dragon's Breath
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You can put more effort into your Kobold Breath to channel greater draconic power, though it takes more out of you.

Name: Duskwalker Magic
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your connection to psychopomps gives you the power to glimpse the near future and protect corpses from the ravages of undeath.

Name: Earthsense
Benefits: Your connection to earth and stone allows you to feel the slightest displacement that disturbs them, down to the shift of a pebble.

Name: Echoes in Stone
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You pause a moment to attune your senses to the stone around you.

Name: Eclectic Sword Training
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You were always taught that you needed to be able to use whatever weapon came your way.

Name: Eerie Compression
Benefits: Your limbs and even your torso can collapse in on themselves, allowing you to fit through tight spaces as though you were a Small creature.

Name: Efreeti Magic
Benefits: The magic of your efreeti ancestors flows through you.

Name: Elf Step
Benefits: You move in a graceful dance, and even your steps are broad.

Name: Energize Wings
Benefits: You stoke your magic to energize your wings, temporarily transforming them into glowing, majestic forms.

Name: Energy Blessed
Benefits: Energy runs through your blood more powerfully.

Name: Evade Doom
Benefits: You can elude supernatural disaster.

Name: Expert Longevity
Benefits: You’ve continued to refine the knowledge and skills you’ve gained through your life.

Name: Fade Away
Benefits: Your ability to blend into the background allows you to fade away entirely or appear innocuous even to magical effects.

Name: Fell Rider
Benefits: You have trained with your animal companion to become a terrifying, unified juggernaut on the battlefield.

Name: Ferocious Gust
Benefits: With heavy wing beats, you whip up a furious gust and direct it at your opponents.

Name: Fey Magic
Benefits: You can use faerie magic to hide yourself and expose hidden foes.

Name: Fiendish Wings
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You can strain to call forth bat-like or otherwise fiendish wings from your back, similar in appearance to those of your fiendish ancestors.

Name: First World Adept
Prerequisites: at least one primal innate spell
Benefits: Over time your fey magic has grown stronger.

Name: Fortuitous Shift
Benefits: You have grown more comfortable with your penchant for supernatural disappearance.

Name: Fox Trick
Benefits: You always have time for a joke or prank.

Name: Freeze It!
Benefits: You are no rime hag or Jadwiga, but the magic of the north has still left a mark on you.

Name: Garuda Magic
Benefits: You are descended from the wondrous garudas, and their keen senses manifest in your magical prowess.

Name: Glory and Valor!
Benefits: You are descended from the einherji, the worthy warriors of chaos.

Name: Grandmother's Wisdom
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: You carry the bones of your ancestors with you, and you can ask them for counsel.

Name: Gripping Limbs
Benefits: Nodules, hooks, or claws on your limbs allow you to cling to surfaces with ease.

Name: Group Aid
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your upbringing emphasized teamwork and helping your allies comes naturally to you.

Name: Guiding Luck
Benefits: Your luck guides you to look the right way and aim your blows unerringly.

Name: Hardy Traveler
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: There's no journey too far or burden too heavy when your friends are at your side.

Name: Hefting Shadow
Benefits: Your shadow can contain objects.

Name: Heir of the Saoc
Benefits: In the past, you would have been a proud initiate of the Saoc Brethren.

Name: Helpful Halfling
Benefits: When you aid a friend with a task, you find many ways to help and avoid interfering.

Name: Heroes' Call
Benefits: The songs of ancient heroes echo through your mind and quicken your pulse, especially in dire straits.

Name: Hungry Goblin
Benefits: You’ll eat anything and anyone.

Name: Improvisational Warrior
Benefits: You have increased skill with improvised weapons.

Name: Incredible Improvisation
Benefits: A stroke of brilliance gives you a major advantage with a skill despite your inexperience.

Name: Inner Breath
Benefits: Your body is capable of recycling its own air.

Name: Internal Respirator
Benefits: Your body can internally synthesize oxygen for limited periods of time.

Name: Invoke the Elements
Prerequisites: Brine May, Snow May, Veil May, or Virga May
Benefits: You summon an aura of shimmering heat, flurrying snow, crashing waves, or swirling wind and lightning.

Name: Irrepressible
Benefits: You are easily able to ward off attempts to play on your fears and emotions.

Name: Janni Hospitality
Benefits: You can use magic to show others desert hospitality.

Name: Janni Magic
Benefits: The magic of jann runs through your blood.

Name: Juvenile Flight
Benefits: You unfold your wings for travel and can keep them unfolded for 10 minutes.

Name: Kneel for No God
Benefits: Your ancestors’ defiance of magic and your people’s strictly egalitarian mindset mean that certain forms of magic have little effect on you.

Name: Larcenous Tail
Benefits: Your tail's chaotic and independent nature causes it to perform mischief even when you don't intend it, and it can somehow steal things it shouldn't be able to handle.

Name: Laughing Gnoll
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: A gnoll's sinister giggle is a sound of warning and threat.

Name: Life Leap
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You phase through a space that a living creature occupies in a flash, spontaneously appearing on the opposite side of it in a vibrant display of colorful light.

Name: Light from Darkness
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You've battled the fiendish power within your nature and come out on top; whatever you decide to do with your life, for good or evil, will be your choice and your choice alone.

Name: Lucky Keepsake
Benefits: You have a keepsake that grants you luck.

Name: Marid Magic
Benefits: You channel the magic of marids.

Name: Mask of Pain
Benefits: Your mask has grown into a manifestation of your pain, which you can release.

Name: Morrigna's Spider Affinity
Benefits: Much like morrignas, you feel an affinity for spiders.

Name: Mother's Mindfulness
Benefits: You have the protective instinct your own mother lacks and will gladly suffer in another's place.

Name: Mountain's Stoutness
Benefits: Your hardiness lets you withstand more punishment than most before going down.

Name: Multitalented
Benefits: You’ve learned to split your focus between multiple classes with ease.

Name: Night Magic
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You can tap into the magic that runs through your blood.

Name: No Evidence
Benefits: You leave little sign when attempting to remain unseen.

Name: Occult Resistance
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your study of occult practices has shown you how to best defend against them.

Name: Offensive Subroutine
Benefits: Nanites augment your attacks.

Name: Otherworldly Acumen
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Prerequisites: at least one innate spell gained from an elf ancestry feat
Benefits: The arcane magic you possess grows in power and complexity.

Name: Overcrowd
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your physiology is slight, and you can pack into small spaces with others of similar stature.

Name: Pack Tactics
Benefits: You have mastered how to hunt with your pack.

Name: Peri Magic
Benefits: The shimmering embers of the righteous peris crackle at your fingertips.

Name: Pervasive Superstition
Benefits: You steep yourself in superstition and practice ancient orc mental exercises for shrugging off the effects of magic.

Name: Piercing Quills
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: Your quills can dig particularly deep into the flesh of your opponents.

Name: Pinch Time
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: One of your parents has a human life span and another an elven life span, with your own somewhere between.

Name: Predator's Growl
Benefits: You give a throaty growl to attempt to Demoralize a creature you just found.

Name: Preemptive Reconfiguration
Benefits: Your body anticipates the blow.

Name: Pride in Arms
Benefits: With a shout of triumph, you grant inspiration to an ally fight on.

Name: Qlippoth Magic
Benefits: You've deeply studied the secrets of your blood and can force reality to act against its own wishes.

Name: Quill Spray
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Prerequisites: Quillcoat Shisk heritage or quill unarmed attack
Benefits: You can launch a mass of quills at opponents.

Name: Rakshasa Magic
Benefits: You remember the secrets of your rakshasa forebears and know how to apply those memories to get results.

Name: Rat Form
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You can transform into an innocuous-looking rat to scout an area or slip through tight spaces.

Name: Read the Stars
Benefits: You're incredibly skilled in iruxi astrology, and you can gain useful (if cryptic) hints from the stars' alignment.

Name: Repair Module
Benefits: You trigger your body's repair programming, causing your body's nanites to heal your wounds.

Name: Replenishing Hydration
Source: Azarketi Ancestry Web Supplement
Benefits: You draw life from the water around you.

Name: Returning Throw
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You have mastered the technique of arcing a projectile so that it returns to your hand after being thrown, though this requires a moment to precisely calculate the trajectory and possible ricochets.

Name: Ricocheting Leap
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: You quickly use your momentum to topple and spring off of foes.

Name: Riptide
Source: Azarketi Ancestry Web Supplement
Benefits: Drag a grabbed creature into nearby water

Name: Rokoan Arts
Benefits: Ancestral spirits have begun to bond themselves to you, granting you powers characteristic of a rokoa.

Name: Roll with It
Benefits: When you take a big hit, your foe bounces you around like a rubber ball, but you escape the worst of the blow.

Name: Scalding Spit
Benefits: Your bodily fluids burn with surprising volatility, as if you ran on oil instead of blood.

Name: Scorching Disarm
Benefits: You make a weapon unbearable to hold.

Name: Sculpt Shadows
Benefits: You coax nearby shadows into the shape of a simple weapon or a simple tool or item, using a tiny piece of your shadow to make it solid; in doing so, you lose 1 Hit Point.

Name: Sense for Trouble
Benefits: You can tell when something's off.

Name: Sense Thoughts
Benefits: You have an even stranger knack for knowing what other people are thinking.

Name: Shadow Sight
Benefits: You draw on your connection with the Shadow Plane to see through all but the deepest darkness.

Name: Shaitan Magic
Benefits: The magic of shaitans runs through your blood.

Name: Shared Luck (Catfolk)
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Other creatures can benefit from your luck

Name: Shory Aeromancer
Prerequisites: Garundi ethnicity, Mauxi ethnicity, or Tian-Yae ethnicity
Benefits: Your ancestors hailed from the flying cities of the Shory, and a few simple tricks have come down through the ages to you.

Name: Silent Step
Benefits: You vanish with silent treads.

Name: Skittering Scuttle
Benefits: You can scuttle farther and faster when maneuvering alongside allies.

Name: Slip into Shadow
Prerequisites: ability to cast at least one spell with the darkness trait
Benefits: Your shadow magic bleeds into the space around you.

Name: Slip the Grasp
Benefits: You have some feature that allows you to quickly evade effects that restrain you.

Name: Snare Commando
Prerequisites: Snare Crafting; expert in Deception or Intimidation
Benefits: Your snares are so befuddling that your victims rarely notice you slipping out of sight.

Name: Soaring Flight
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: To be a tengu is to be unburdened by the concerns of the world below.

Name: Sodbuster
Benefits: Years toiling in soil have made you an expert digger.

Name: Solar Rejuvenation
Benefits: If you rest outdoors for 10 minutes during the day, you regain Hit Points equal to your Constitution modifier × half your level.

Name: Spirit Strikes
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your connection to the Boneyard empowers you to bring death to all forms of life and unlife, exploiting their weaknesses.

Name: Spore Cloud
Benefits: You unleash a cloud of pollen or similar spores.

Name: Squad Tactics
Benefits: You are adept at working with your allies to surround a foe.

Name: Stone Bones
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your intractable nature can help you shrug off even the most grievous injuries.

Name: Stonewalker
Benefits: You have a deep reverence for and connection to stone.

Name: Strand Strider
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: Your eight legs serve you well when climbing walls and webs alike.

Name: Strong Swimmer
Benefits: Your swim Speed increases to match your land Speed.

Name: Studious Adept
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: You achieve a breakthrough in your exploration of magic.

Name: Terrain Advantage
Benefits: You can take advantage of the terrain to bypass foes’ defenses.

Name: Tetraelemental Assault
Benefits: Your Elemental Assault cycles through all four elements.

Name: Thorned Seedpod
Benefits: When your seedpods strike a felling blow, they burst into viciously thorny vines.

Name: Tongue Tether
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: Your tongue can momentarily latch on as readily as your hands.

Name: Tree Climber (Elf)
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You've spent much of your life among the treetops and have become an expert at quickly and safely climbing them.

Name: Uncanny Cheeks
Benefits: You squirrel away useful objects and seem to retrieve them at just the right time.

Name: Undying Ferocity
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You resist death's clutches with supernatural vigor.

Name: Unhampered Passage
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You won't allow others to restrain you.

Name: Velstrac Magic
Benefits: You know there's so much more to sensation than whips and chains—but whips and chains also have their place.

Name: Virtue-Forged Tattoos
Benefits: Your tattoos are a work of eldritch genius, a masterpiece of art, magic, and skin.

Name: Vivacious Conduit
Benefits: Your connection to the First World has grown, and its positive energy flows into you rapidly.

Name: Wary Skulker
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Ever alert, you scout for danger even when you are trying to stay hidden.

Name: Water Dancer
Benefits: You glide through the water with graceful ease.

Name: Water Strider
Benefits: Water cradles your every step, allowing you to walk on its surface.

Name: Web Hunter
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: Through the careful cultivation of highly sensitive hairs, you've developed the ability to sense creatures without seeing them.

Name: Well-Groomed
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You are fastidious about keeping yourself clean

Name: Wind God's Fan
Benefits: Your fan can stir up even more powerful winds.

Name: Wing Step
Benefits: With a sharp flap of your wings, you stay light on your feet as you move.

Name: Wings of Air
Benefits: You can strain to call forth feathered or cloudy wings from your back.

Name: Accursed Clay Fist
Prerequisites: Golem Grafter Dedication; expert in unarmed attacks
Benefits: You have replaced one of your forearms with one made of clay and infused with cursed arcane magic.

Name: Agile Grace
Benefits: Your graceful moves with agile weapons are beyond compare.

Name: Ancestral Mage
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: The magic of your ancestry and bloodline are one and the same.

Name: Angel of Death
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: All your Strikes against a creature you have Marked for Death have the death trait, causing the mark to be instantly killed when reduced to 0 Hit Points.

Name: Annotate Composition
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: By putting composition to paper, you can create a source of stirring words or song that others can read and understand.

Name: Armor Rune Shifter
Source: Pathfinder #148
Benefits: You learn the secrets of armor runes by viewing them through gems and can alter them at your discretion.

Name: Armored Rest
Prerequisites: Swordmaster Dedication; trained in light, medium, or heavy armor
Benefits: You've slept many nights in your armor and gotten used to it.

Name: Assured Ritualist
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You can cover for a secondary caster's error.

Name: Attunement to Stone
Benefits: You can feel vibrations through the ground.

Name: Beastmaster Bond
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You can communicate telepathically with your animal companions within 100 feet.

Name: Beneath Notice
Prerequisites: Golden League Xun Dedication; expert in Deception
Benefits: You are skilled at hiding from your foes and targets among the common populace.

Name: Bestiary Scholar
Prerequisites: Scrollmaster Dedication; master in Arcana, Crafting, Nature, Occultism, or Religion
Benefits: You learn how to apply your extensive knowledge of certain creatures using the lore you know.

Name: Blazing Streak
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: Stride twice, making Strikes against up to four different creatures within reach at any point during your movement.

Name: Buckler Dance
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You spin your buckler defensively toward every attack.

Name: Burrowing Form
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: Your eidolon can burrow through loose dirt.

Name: Camouflage
Benefits: You alter your appearance to blend in to the wilderness.

Name: Cascade Bearer's Spellcasting
Prerequisites: Magaambyan Attendant Dedication; Cascade Bearers affiliation
Benefits: Your Cascade Bearer training allows you to broaden the horizons of your halcyon spells further than most Magaambyans, weaving in spiritual magic.

Name: Cascading Ray
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: Magical energy spills out to extend beyond the creature you struck.

Name: Castigating Weapon
Benefits: The force of your deity’s castigation strengthens your body so you can strike down the wicked.

Name: Cautious Delver
Benefits: You've studied the many ways that ancient architects and spellcasters protected their possessions, such as by implementing deadly traps and curses, and learned some magic to counteract them.

Name: Certain Strike
Benefits: Even when you don’t hit squarely, you can still score a glancing blow.

Name: Cobra Envenom
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Prerequisites: Cobra Stance; expert in unarmed attacks
Benefits: You lash out with devious intent and the power to envenom your foe.

Name: Combat Reflexes
Benefits: You are particularly swift at punishing foes who leave you openings.

Name: Come and Get Me
Benefits: You open yourself to attacks so you can respond in turn.

Name: Command Attention
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You command the attention of all around you with style, ensuring their gaze falls only upon you until the end of your next turn.

Name: Communal Tale
Source: Pathfinder #170
Benefits: Stories are an experience meant to be shared as a group.

Name: Courageous Assault
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: With a mighty shout, you can stir an ally to attack.

Name: Cut from the Air
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You can knock aside ranged attacks.

Name: Daring Flourish
Benefits: You make quick use of an opening from your daring stunts.

Name: Dazzling Block
Source: Secrets of Magic
Prerequisites: Arcane Cascade, sparkling targe hybrid study
Benefits: When you use Shield Block, you can create a flash of brilliant, multicolored light in a 15-foot cone.

Name: Debilitating Shot
Benefits: Aiming for a weak point, you impede your foe with a precise shot.

Name: Demanding Challenge
Benefits: If your skill check to challenge a foe is a success, the target of your challenge takes a –1 circumstance penalty to attack rolls (or –2 if you critically succeed) until the end of your next turn.

Name: Deny Support
Benefits: Keep opponents from flanking when you Feint them.

Name: Deny the Songs of War
Source: Pathfinder #170
Benefits: To keep the peace, you disrupt those who seek to break it.

Name: Derring-Do
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: When you compound panache with even more derring-do, it somehow tends to work out.

Name: Destructive Block
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You can protect yourself more effectively, at the expense of your shield.

Name: Determined Dash
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Nothing can keep you from your enemy.

Name: Devoted Focus
Benefits: Your devotion is strong enough to increase your focus to incredible heights.

Name: Dimensional Disappearance
Source: Secrets of Magic
Prerequisites: dimensional assault focus spell, laughing shadow hybrid study
Benefits: You take advantage of teleportation to better hide your position.

Name: Disarming Twist
Benefits: After your initial attack redirects your foe’s defenses, your follow-up wrests their weapon from their grasp.

Name: Disruptive Stance
Benefits: The slightest distraction can provoke your wrath, and you’re prepared to foil enemies’ actions.
